Description: Substantially preserved papyrus roll containing hieroglyphic text and vignettes in black only, from the Book of the Dead, for a man named Thutrekhsu. Mounted in two frames.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: William John Bankes
Curator's comments: Published: Mosher, Catalogue of the Books of the Dead in the BM: The Papyrus of Hor, (2001), 92 n.98-9&102&105, p.93 n.116&119-20. Mosher, Malcom Jr. 2016. The Book of the Dead, Saite through Ptolemaic periods : a study of traditions evident in versions of texts and vignettes (SPBD Studies), vol. I (BD Spells 1-15) and II (BD Spells 16, 18-30), Charleston.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57529) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57529)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: loss Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A
